meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be reproduced or replicated.
meanings.sent1: The reproducibility of the painting allowed the artist to create multiple copies.
meanings.sent2: Scientists value reproducibility in their experiments to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick had such reproducibility that he could perform it flawlessly every time.
meanings.sent4: The reproducibility of the recipe made it a favorite among home cooks.
meanings.sent5: The reproducibility of the melody made it easy for the choir to learn.

meanings.definition: The ability for an experiment or study to be repeated with consistent results.
meanings.sent1: The reproducibility of the data confirmed the validity of the study.
meanings.sent2: Teachers emphasize the importance of reproducibility in scientific investigations.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke had such reproducibility that it made everyone laugh every time.
meanings.sent4: The reproducibility of the athlete's performance under pressure was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The reproducibility of the magic trick amazed the audience every time.
